0x16.label: TravelSpeed
0x16.note: the speed that the projectile travels at

0x17.label: BulletHitAnimation
0x17.note: The animation to play when projectile hits something (index? but doesn't appear in DEMO.DAS or ADEMO.DAS)

0x30.label: FlashScreen
0x30.note: Flashes the environment. First darkness then brightness. Value is the intensity

0x02.label: If item acount above, continue
0x02.note: first two bytes represent the item index to check. the third byte represents the number to do a "greater than" comparison against.

0x33.label: WeaponIconUI
0x33.note: Which icon to display on screen for an equipped weapon (0x0A is unused Mace)

0x2d.note: Only 1, 4, or 7 in global commands or 0x05 for weapons or for monsters: 0x02 = primary  attack triggered from range; or 0x03 = secondary attack triggered from range

0x20.label: WeaponAmmoRecharge
0x20.note:
the inventory index of the ammo refill.
when second byte is 80, it's a rechargeable weapon and the first byte represents ammo recharge rate

0x12.label: WeaponAnimation
0x12.note: The passive and attacking weapon animation. Offset to the animation

0x18.label: WeaponBulletDelay
0x18.note: For weapon, the delay after firing to spawn the bullet object

0xa2.label: Weapon X screen offset
0xa2.note: offsets the weapon's onscreen horizontal position (affects where projectile is fired)

0x2c.label: WeaponAnimationSpeed
0x2c.note: for a weapon, modifies the animation play speed (directly impacts fire rate)

0x00.label: InventoryDocumentImage
0x00.note: for notes/maps/etc, the image to show after initial animation

0xa8.label: SetMonsterSecondaryBullet
0xa8.note: sets the bullet for a monster's secondary attack

0x28.label: SetMonsterBullet
0x28.note: sets the bullet for a monster's primary attack

0xa7.label: BulletVulnerable
0xa7.note: For a monster, set vulnerability against a bullet (bullet does 2x damage). this can stack

0x27.label: BulletImmunity
0x27.note: For a monster, sets the immunity against a bullet by index (bullet does no damage) (when value is 0xFFFF, immune to all bullets)

0xa9.label: OnMonsterDamageSFX
0xa9.note: For a monster, what sound effect to play on damage (when run multiple times, randomly chooses one) (bugged? when multiple are selected, will not play the last one? need to add it twice)

0x29.label: MonsterRoamingSFX
0x29.note: sets the sound effect to play during enemy roam (multiple can be set with multiple calls) (0xFFFF for silence)

0xb1.label: MonsterCritDeathSFX
0xb1.note: The sound effect to play when monster critically dies (like from max health in a single hit)

0x31.label: MonsterDeathSFX
0x31.note: the sound effect to play when the monster dies (but not critically dies, see 0xB1)

0x2a.label: MonsterPrimAttackSFX
0x2a.note: sets the sound effect to play when monster makes its primary attack

0x2b.label: MonsterPrimAttackDelay
0x2b.note: the delay to spawn the bullet for an monster's primary attack

0xaa.label: MonsterSecondAttackSFX
0xaa.note: the sound effect to play when monster makes its secondary attack

0xab.label: MonsterSecondAttackDelay
0xab.note: the delay to spawn the bullet for a monster's secondary attack

0x32.label: MonsterSpawnSFX
0x32.note: the sound effect to play when the monster spawns

0x26.label: SetHealthOrHeal
0x26.note: Initializes max health of a monster or heals by value

0x0f.label: SetInformationTopic
0x0f.note: used with the 0x01 trigger code to set up discussion topics when examining an item. value is the index (must confirm) to a string interface which will be displayed when the "i" button is pressed in inventory. when the topic is pressed, the contained command chain is run

0x10.label: ChangeName
0x10.note: used with the 0x02 trigger to change the name of an item (usually with some flag; if so call 0x01 AFTER this one). the value is the index (must confirm) of the string/interface

0x0e.label: DisplayTheEnd
0x0e.note: displays a texture onscreen (DBASE300 Offset / 8). But is only used to display the "The End" screen

0x23.label: MapCommandIndexCallback
0x23.note: Performs a script from the current .RAW map file. value is the command index

0x36.label: MapCommandIDCallback
0x36.note: Performs a script from the current .RAW map file. value is the command ID

0x91.label: RemoveItem
0x91.note: removes item from inventory. value is item index

0x9c.label: ExitCommand
0x9c.note: always FF FF FF; used to end a command flow's execution

0x35.label: Dbase100CommandCallback
0x35.note: performs a dbase100 command corresponding to its index

0x34.label: CombineWithItem
0x34.note: set during the OnUse trigger (0x0b) and makes the current item combinable with another item whose index is the argument required for this command. run 0xB4 after this to set the item that the two will be replaced with

0xb4.label: SetCombinedItem
0xb4.note: used after command 0x34 to determine the final item when two items are combined. value is the item index of the final result item. When no 0x34 command is used, the item can be combined with itself (ie, used).

0x82.label: If item count below or equal, continue
0x82.note: checks if the count of an item id in inventory is below a certain number and continues if so. first two bytes represent the item index to check. the third byte represents the number to do a "less than" comparison against.

0x83.label: If item count equal, continue
0x83.note: checks if the count of an item id in inventory is equal to a certain amount. first two bytes represent the item index to check. the third byte represents the amount to compare with

0x0d.label: If flag set, then next command

0x8d.label: If not flag set, next command
